Tender Title: CPU 4054 - Fixed & Portable Fire Safety Appliances - Repairs and Maintenance
Tender Description:
Nottingham City Council is seeking tenders from suitably experienced and qualified entities for the provision of the following services:

1. Planned Maintenance and Remedial Works
2. Reactive Maintenance
3. Delivery of minor improvement works

To the following assets:
i) Fire Hydrants
ii) Fire Protection Equipment
iii) Fire Shutters and Curtains
iv) Smoke Vents
v) Wet and Dry Risers
vi) Fire doors

Nottingham City Homes (NCH) is an Arms' Length Management Organisation (ALMO) created in 2005 by Nottingham City Council to manage its housing stock of 27,000 rented homes and over 1,000 leasehold properties. This includes approximately 18,000 houses and bungalows, 2,000 high rise flats and almost 8,000 low rise flats (including independent living accommodation for older people).  

Nottingham City Homes is a not-for-profit company run by a Board of non-executive directors. The Board is made up of tenants, leaseholders, councillors nominated by Nottingham City Council and independent members.

Our strategic goals are set out within our Corporate Plan:
•	To listen to our residents and deliver an excellent housing service
•	To make all our estates great places to live
•	To build high quality, affordable new homes for local people
•	To diversify our services, reinvesting in our communities
•	To be a great place to work.

Overall Requirements

Nottingham City Homes in partnership with Nottingham City Council wishes to appoint a developer through the open tender procedure for the design development and construction of forty eight apartments.
The site which is the subject of this tender is:
    
Oakdene
Woodborough Road
St Ann's
Nottingham
NG3 1AH
    
Design quality will be a key element in the evaluation of the tenders received as the projects will set a benchmark for future regeneration projects in the districts involved.

Information has been prepared up to RIBA Stage 3 and is pending planning application approval by Nottingham City Council Development.
